channel.title: python on Anthony Dellavecchia
channel.description: Recent content in python on Anthony Dellavecchia

item.title: Summarize Text from Images Using AI, Python, and Twilio
item.description: TLDR: This is a tutorial on how to build a Python app that will summarize text that you take from images. Overview Content, content, content! There’s too much content out there and too much to read. Don’t you wish you could pull out your phone -> take a picture of a book -> get texted a summary of what it says? I built a Python app that does just this, and I’ll teach you how you can build it too.

item.title: Summarize Text from Images
item.description: See some text you don’t want to read? Pull out your phone -> Take a picture of it -> Get texted a summary of what it says Here’s a gif of using it in action: I also wrote a tutorial, so you can build this app yourself. Check it out on Twilio’s Blog. You can check out the code on GitHub.

item.title: Get The Latest NBA News Sent to Your Phone via SMS
item.description: TLDR: This is a tutorial on how to build a Python app that will text you NBA news. Overview It’s F5 season!!! The NBA offseason is underway and players trades are shocking the NBA world. Send a text that says “F5” to get NBA news for the current day. So keep F5ing throughout the day to stay caught up on news. Tutorial Technologies used in this project are Twilio, SportsDataIO, Python, Flask, and ngrok.

item.title: NBA News
item.description: I built an app that sends you NBA news whenever you text “F5” to your Twilio phone number. Why? Well, during the NBA offseason, fans want to have up-to-date info about recent trades or trade requests. I also wrote a tutorial, so you can build this app yourself. Check it out on Twilio’s Blog. You can check out the code on GitHub.

item.title: MongoDB Atlas Hackathon
item.description: TLDR: I participated in a MongoDB Hackathon and share what I learned about MongoDB and Django. Hackathon On Dev Community, I saw a post for a Hackathon sponsored by MongoDB and thought I’d give it a shot. I have no experience with MongoDB so I thought it’d be fun. Unfortunately, I saw the post only a few days before the due date, so I didn’t have enough time to finish it.
